body: Definitely concerning: I'm back from vacation today and will take a look.
Okay, I can reproduce that, it's very odd. Looking into it today.

Hmm, this is interesting.

The actual error from the invalid flag comes from [`SkyframeExecutor.createBuildConfigurationKey`](https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/skyframe/SkyframeExecutor.java?q=symbol%3A%5Cbcom.google.devtools.build.lib.skyframe.SkyframeExecutor.createBuildConfigurationKey%5Cb%20case%3Ayes), which creates the initial top-level configuration based on the command line (and bazelrcs, etc).

During the sequence here, we see:
1. The `platform` has only valid flags: `SkyframeExecutor.createBuildConfigurationKey` is called, creates a configuration object, and returns it.
2. The `platform` has invalid flags: `SkyframeExecutor.createBuildConfigurationKey` is called, **finds a previously-created configuration object**, uses that and continues.

It looks like calling into skyframe at this point is **before** any invalidation checking due to changed file, but I'm not sure, I need to check with the experts. An important question (which I can check) is whether or not [`BuildConfigurationKeyFunction`](https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/skyframe/config/BuildConfigurationKeyFunction.java?q=BuildConfigurationKeyFunction&ss=bazel) is being called again or not.

I suspect this is actually worse: I suspect that edits to change flags in  avalid way are also being ignored.

Actually, nope, it's a much more basic problem: inside [`BuildConfigurationKeyProducer` is a cache](https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/analysis/producers/BuildConfigurationKeyProducer.java;drc=369590922eaa8ecfec62ef2b4710174b5e21bae3;l=50), and that's not being invalidated when the platform definition changes.

I need to either fix the key to the cache, or figure out when/how to invalidate it.

Current ideas I am investigating:
1. Clear the cache at the start of every build
2. Hoist the cache into ConfiguredTargetFunction so that it isn't static but has a shorter lifetime
   1. I'm worried about making it too short
3. Skyframe magic (I've reached out to the experts to find out if anything useful exists)
   1. The best idea would be to invalidate the cache if the requested PlatformMappingValue.Key or ConfiguredTargetKeys are invalidated, but I don't know if this is detectable

I'll update when I know more.

issue.title: Label flag transitions are cached incorrectly

labels.name: team-Configurability
labels.description: platforms, toolchains, cquery, select(), config transitions

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
### Description of the bug:


If you modify which target a label flag points to in a transition, Bazel will fail to invalidate the cache.

I verified this bug is present in versions `8.0.0-pre.20240618.2` and https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/0ddcfd327ffd012d348deeae08ec0836409706ad. But it _does not_ reproduce on 7.2.1.

@katre 

### Which category does this issue belong to?

Configurability

### What's the simplest, easiest way to reproduce this bug? Please provide a minimal example if possible.


https://github.com/tpudlik/label_flag_transition_cache_bug

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


Linux

### What is the output of `bazel info release`?


release 8.0.0-pre.20240618.2

### If `bazel info release` returns `development version` or `(@non-git)`, tell us how you built Bazel.


_No response_

### What's the output of `git remote get-url origin; git rev-parse HEAD` ?


_No response_

### If this is a regression, please try to identify the Bazel commit where the bug was introduced with bazelisk --bisect.


Yes, it's a regression, but it's a little tricky to construct the `--bisect` for it because it's a caching issue. I decided to file it before figuring one out. Sorry!

### Have you found anything relevant by searching the web?

Seemed related to https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/22995, but the fix for that issue doesn't fix this one.

### Any other information, logs, or outputs that you want to share?

_No response_

issue.title: Better handling for caches in skyfunctions

labels.name: P2
labels.description: We'll consider working on this in future. (Assignee optional)

labels.name: team-Core
labels.description: Skyframe, bazel query, BEP, options parsing, bazelrc

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
We have several caches used currently in skyfunction implementations, with many specifically, used directly or indirectly from `ConfiguredTargetFunction`. Some examples are:
- [`StarlarkTransitionCache`](https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/analysis/config/StarlarkTransitionCache.java?ss=bazel&q=caffeine&start=31)
- [`BuildConfigurationKeyCache`](https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/analysis/producers/BuildConfigurationKeyCache.java?ss=bazel&q=caffeine&start=41)
- [`PlatformMappingValue.parserCache`](https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/skyframe/config/PlatformMappingValue.java;drc=0803ad3770155be411a703950502dc71743017bd;l=152?ss=bazel&q=caffeine&start=21)
- [`StarlarkDefinedConfigTransition.ruleTransitionCache`](https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/analysis/config/StarlarkDefinedConfigTransition.java?q=symbol%3A%5Cbcom.google.devtools.build.lib.analysis.config.StarlarkDefinedConfigTransition.ruleTransitionCache%5Cb%20case%3Ayes)

Each of these are used to cache expansive computations that may be repeated multiple times in the same build (ie, in one `bazel build` call). Each of these would ideally also persist from build to build in case the same computation is needed across builds.

We've also seen several classes of error arising from the files used to determine cache values being changed between builds, but the cache not being invalidated:
- https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/22995 - Flags from `platform` weren't re-computed when the underlying BUILD file changed
- https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/23097 - Transitions weren't re-computed when the underlying bzl file changed.

There may well be more of these.
